Erik Wilde (@dret): How to Accelerate your API Journey

(2) Summary

APIs are the connective fabric of digital transformation. But they are only as useful as the capabilities they are representing, and only productive when they can be changed easily, frequently, and without the need for coordination. We look at the factors that really matter for API utility at the business level, and what it takes to change these factors when embarking on your API journey. We look at the trajectory of developing an API strategy for explicit goals, establishing an API program to realize these goals, and cultivating an API mindset across the organization.

Journey Essentials Erik Wilde (@dret): How to Accelerate your API Journey

(8) Start Small

  • Identify low-hanging fruit for quick success and feedback
    • API Archaeology is a good way to find candidates
  • Switch from building systems to cultivating ecosystems
    • Focus on constraints (what to do) over rules (how to do it)
    • Only govern when you must (autonomy) and not when you can (authority)
  • Start building a culture and a community
    • API Guidelines should reflect the lived reality in an organization


Journey Essentials Erik Wilde (@dret): How to Accelerate your API Journey

(9) Design for Change

  • Ecosystem architecture and system architecture are distinct disciplines
    • APIs allow you to start building a landscape of API products
    • How to build API products is a different and distinct task
  • The role of ecosystem architecture is to support development teams
    • Constrain them as much as necessary but as little as possible
    • Cleanly separate constraints from how to implement them
    • Provide support for following constraints and testing for them
  • Always ask yourself how much effort it is to change course
    • Good ecosystem architecture scales over size and time and change frequency


Journey Essentials Erik Wilde (@dret): How to Accelerate your API Journey

(10) Cultivate the Landscape

  • Be clear on your vision and strategy
  • Start with small and focused effort and teams
  • Build up competencies and ways to share them across teams
  • Shift from centralized systems to decentralized ecosystems


Journey Essentials Erik Wilde (@dret): How to Accelerate your API Journey

(13) Two Common API Goals



Strategic API Focus Erik Wilde (@dret): How to Accelerate your API Journey

(14) Scenario 1: Engaging in the API Economy

  • Direct API monetization
  • API foundation for user journeys (omni-channel)
  • Value chain optimization (outsourced APIs)


Strategic API Focus Erik Wilde (@dret): How to Accelerate your API Journey

(15) Scenario 2: APIs for Modular Architecture

  • Moving from integration to interconnection (IT modernization)
  • Decoupling products and their development cycles and speed
  • Improving capability reuse across the whole organization

(17) Mind the Gap



From Vision to Value Erik Wilde (@dret): How to Accelerate your API Journey

(18) API Strategy = Pillars × Perspectives

External Internal
Biz
  • API monetization
  • Revenue-supporting APIs
  • Increase speed & feedback
  • Identify & stabilize enablers
  • Design for externalization
  • Increase biz insight with dashboards
Org
  • Focus on documentation/DX
  • Support discovery/self-service
  • Collect DX feedback
  • Products > projects (ownership)
  • Team enablement/support
  • Loose coupling for speed/agility
Tech
  • Tech trends and popularity
  • Invest in on-boarding support
  • Secure through platform
  • Loosely coupled implementations
  • Observe patterns and practices
  • Establish C4E for platform/support


From Vision to Value Erik Wilde (@dret): How to Accelerate your API Journey

(19) Create a Culture of Caring and Sharing

  • Why does the guideline exist?
    • Rationale for creating the guideline
  • What can be done to address the described issue
    • At least one good solution for addressing the issue
  • How to implement the solution
    • At least one way to use the solution in practice
  • Testing that the guideline has been followed
    • Some tests can be automated but many will be by declaration or review


Conclusions

Conclusions Erik Wilde (@dret): How to Accelerate your API Journey

(21) Der Weg ist das Ziel

  • Avoid a waterfall model for your API journey
  • Start small and iterate and learn from the process
  • Design for change because change is the only constant
  • Build communities that cultivate and evolve practices


Conclusions Erik Wilde (@dret): How to Accelerate your API Journey
